reviews.text:
good for travelers who want to see history about world war 2
this place is real camp.
Amazing history. Incredibly humbling.
Nice and peaceful area.
cool cemetry
สุสานทหารที่นี่คนมานัอยมาก บรรยากาศร่มรื่นมากคะ

Beautiful, immaculately kept war cemetary of the victims of the Death Railway construction located next to the Death Railway Museum. There are Australian, Dutch and American servicemen's graves, also memorial plates listing many names of the fallen. Quiet, reflexive atmosphere and a relief to the eye from Thai urban chaos.
Looks like any other war cemetery. Not very large. Good for a quick 15 min stroll. It more like a “may as well come by” place since u will have to pass by on the way to the River Kwai bridge.

Typical War Cemetery, well maintained. We spent over an hour here walking amongst the graves and noticed a few young people aged 18 and 19 who died here during the building of the railway. It is hard to fathom how these young people would have felt during their last days. I feel for them and their families. Lest We Forget.
Well kept and interesting place to learn some history.  It was humbling to say the least.  Recommended!
Very well kept by the Thai peoples . Respected

reviews.author_name: โลกสีสวยCHAROEN SEESUAY
reviews.text: World War ll and​ JEATH War​ Museum Kanchanaburi​
I love hotchpotch musea like this. You could call the displays clumsy, sure. But it's all the better for it: plenty to explore and marvel at (despite the grim subject matter).

Some very interesting sections, although not very well maintained as there is dust and dirt all over the place. A bit eclectic as well. Several exhibits on WWII weapons and history, as well as some on subjects as far ranging as the history of Miss Thailand, human evolution, ancient Siamese princes, gems, and murals of Thai politicians. With obly a 40 baht entrance fee, you can slip in here if you're visiting the bridge. But otherwise don't go out of your way.
Certainly glad I went. The history is not showcased well, but there is certainly a lot of neat stuff to see and learn.
Fantastic and memories

The best experience of my Thailand trip. Although it is a 3 hour trip from Bangkok, it is still worth it. The location may be difficult to find for the foreigners. I joined a local tour to visit the place, which in my opinion is the easier way. Getting in water with elephants is magical and exciting. Never expected that one day I would get fully wet by the elephants. Remember to bring extra clothes  because you are guaranteed to get all soaked up. Remember to wear contact lenses if nearsightedness is your problem because elephants may bring you into the water. If you wear glasses, they may get flushed away by the river.
It is a remarkable feeling standing next the these magnificent animals. You truly feel small. Gentle Giants. Sad that they've been using these animals for commercial use.
Amazing place and they seem to really look after the elephants and care for them!!!
Great fun. Elephants appeared well cared for.  They strive to make you enjoy your visit.
I will surely go back to this place... I loved the hospitality of the people around.
Not bad. Friendly service.
It shut down.
Food was decent and the prices were very reasonable. There's plenty of choices from one end of the street to the next end. A must visit when you come to Chumphon.
So fun ! Got the deepfried bread with coconut frosting
Night market not big but definetelly worth visiting
Small nigh street shopping.
Nice attraction for tourist that visit Chumphon. The mango rice and the thai pastry shop next to it is a must try and you can find all sorts of delicious desserts along the night bazaar.

Very, very good food. We're not vegetarian we just decided to eat here due to the good reviews. We had green curry and pad Thai, both where fantastic. Fresh fragrant curry full of flavour and very good pad Thai with a range of textures and flavour. Recommended to anyone for a meal in Kanchanaburi.

This wonderful cafe / restaurant is situated on the main road in Kanchanaburi on the right hand side about a ten minute taxi ride from the bridge. There are a limited number of outside tables but many in the air conditioned inside. The owner On and her team take grest pride in the food and drink they present and I can truthfully say our food was some of the best we'd ever tasted. The establishment was spotlessly clean and the welcome so warm! We can highly recommend this establishment to vegetarians / vegans and those who don't need to eat meat and fish all the time! Wonderful food and wonderful service! 😀👍

Came here with our two sons, mostly to appease my wife who tries to eat little meat, but this was a super meal (no qualifiers like "vegetarian" needed).  Food was delicious, fast, fresh, with wonderful seasonings, all the staff were terrific, and portions were appropriate for people who have hungry kids.  The (lemon) mint shake was also superb and mango sticky rice (with banana) highlighted the huge difference carefully selected ingredients can make - the best we've had (and we've had it a LOT).  If we were staying in town another day, I'd take the cooking class to learn about a few of the dishes seasonings ...seriously fantastic.

Vegetarians paradise. 
I stayed at Kanchanaburi for 4 days and ate there everyday at least twice a day. You don't need to try another place. I have tryed 10 dishes and all of them where amazingly tasty! On is the number one cook in Thailand! If you have one day try the pineapple fried rice and thank me later.

Highly recommend this place for a meal and lemon shake! The food is amaaaazing. We had panang curry and vege cashew stirfry. It’s on the main road, easy to find. We stumbled across it just as a thunderstorm started and were so glad we ended up there. They do a cooking class too. Staff a really friendly. Quick service.
Not bad. Friendly service.
It shut down.

I'm just going to rate this place based on decor since it was so crowded we didn't get a chance to order a drink and we left. It looks nice !!! Looks like you are in a small classy library drinking with your schoolmates. I would go again if it wasn't so crowded and easier to get seats.
This place has a very chill vibe to it. It doesn't really have a view of LA like many other bars, but the live music and artist make it come together. Great place!

Came here after going to the Standard. It's a very cute little bar! Probably not somewhere to go to if you're looking for a bigger scene, but this bar definitely has character and has a more hipster feel. It can also get pretty packed so don't expect a quiet night here either.

I wanted to post a food pic but it looked so good I couldn't stop. Next time I'll be back with my friends. Bring your appetite because portions are filling. I can see why they have so many great reviews.
Great cocktails, nice atmosphere, I'll definitely be back again and again.
One star is missing because we waited for almost an hour for our food but other than that is great. Food was good, as well as the size portion. Didn’t tried the dessert we were too full

We had the 700g T-Bone medium rare, Hawaiian with extra cheese pizza, and lastly as a slice of Almond Praline cake.

One side of the T-Bone steak came nicely medium rare, very tasty and just the right amount of chew. The other side, however, is a disappointment, it's rare near the bone and too charred on the edges. 

The pizza is the thin crust type and is very good. 

The slice of cake is stale. Probably too long in the fridge. The cream is harder then usual, and the cake inside is dry. 

For the steak and pizza done right is positive. Service is prompt.
Very good food for a fair price! Delicious dessert as well!  I will come back !
Now my favourite restaurant in Kanchanaburi. Very edible steaks, pasta etc at very low prices.
Food is very good, reasonable prices,thai and western food served.the terimasu is to die for.service is a little slow at times.
